meanings.definition: To steal more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: The sneaky raccoon was outthieving the other animals in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The thief was caught outthieving his partner in the jewelry store.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat thought it was outthieving the dog's treats.
meanings.sent4: The outthieving squirrel hoarded all the nuts in the park.
meanings.sent5: The pirate captain was known for outthieving all other pirates on the high seas.

meanings.definition: The act of stealing more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: The outthieving of the jewels was a daring heist that made headlines.
meanings.sent2: The competition between the two thieves led to an intense outthieving contest.
meanings.sent3: The outthieving of cookies from the jar was a secret mission for the kids.
meanings.sent4: Her reputation as the queen of outthieving in the city was well-known.
meanings.sent5: The outthieving of ideas in the office caused tension among coworkers.
